title.value: Studying the Practices of Deploying Machine Learning Projects on Docker
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at multiple locations in the paper, including at the beginning and in the header of each page.
title.quote: Studying the Practices of Deploying Machine Learning Projects on Docker

extractions.description: This paper investigates how Docker is used for deploying machine learning projects. It categorizes the types of ML software projects using Docker and examines the purposes and functionalities of Docker deployment. An exploratory empirical study is conducted analyzing 406 open-source ML-based projects to draw these insights.

type.justification: The paper reports an empirical study involving the analysis of 406 open-source ML-based software projects to understand Docker practices.
type.quote: In this study, we conducted an exploratory empirical study to understand how Docker is being used in the deployment process of ML-based software projects.

name.justification: The study focuses on deployment practices using Docker in software systems, which is a core aspect of software engineering.
name.quote: Researchers [4, 8, 16, 22, 23, 25] have extensively studied the use of Docker for the deployment process of general software systems.

name.justification: The deployment of machine learning projects using Docker is the specific context being studied.
name.quote: In this study, we conducted an exploratory empirical study to understand how Docker is being used in the deployment process of ML-based software projects.

name.justification: MLOps is explicitly mentioned as one of the categories of ML-based projects using Docker for deployment.
name.quote: We observed that a variety of ML-based software projects use Docker for deployment, including ML Applications System, MLOps/ AIOps projects, Toolkits, DL Frameworks, ML models, and Documentation repositories.
